name: Quizateria II, Son Of Quizateria  | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the stage name used by Arnold Schwarzenegger for his first film, 1969's 'Hercules in New York' ?
questions.explanation:
Arnold Strong.

	The film was released in 1970 as a comedy, under the title 'Hercules Goes Bananas'.

questions.text: What was the age of the oldest Olympic athlete to win a gold medal ?
questions.explanation:
64 years.

	Oscar Swahn won the running deer shooting event, in the 1912 Summer Olympics in Stockholm.

questions.text: All of these are countries mentioned in the O'Jays' hit 'Love Train', EXCEPT ?
questions.explanation:
France.

	Russia, Africa and Israel are the others mentioned.

questions.text: Prince Charles of Great Britain holds all of these titles, EXCEPT ?
questions.explanation:
Duke of Devon.

	He actually holds eight titles in total, Prince of Wales being the best known.

questions.text: Up until the year 2000, what is the number of U.S. Presidents who never attended college ?
questions.explanation:
9.

	George Washington was the first, and Harry Truman was the last to not attend college.

questions.text: 'Thrilla in Manila' was the nickname of the heavyweight championship fight between which two boxing greats ?
questions.explanation:
Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier.

	In October 1975, before 28,000 spectators and 700 million tv viewers, Ali outlasted Frazier in a brutal 15 round battle in Manila.

questions.text: What was the original working title of the Broadway musical, 'West Side Story' ?
questions.explanation:
'East Side Story'.

	The film version won 10 Academy awards, including Best Picture.

questions.text: All of these are rooms featured in the standard edition of the board game Clue, EXCEPT ?
questions.explanation:
Living Room.

	There are nine rooms in total. The others are, the Billiard Room, Conservatory, Hall, Kitchen, Library and Study.

questions.text: What was the former name of Australia ?
questions.explanation:
New Holland.

	It was given this name by Dutch explorer Abel Tasman circa 1642.

questions.text: Many surnames originally had meanings that were occupations. What was the meaning of the name Wainwright ?
questions.explanation:
Wagon maker.

	Wood cutter was Hacker, weaver was Webster and money changer was the name Wechsler.
